snippet: The White House and the Federal Communications Commission said consumers should be free to unlock their phones once contracts are satisfied.
abstract: Obama administration and the Federal Communications Commission say consumers should be free to unlock their cellphones when they switch carriers once initial contracts are satisfied; freedom to keep phone regardless of carrier has become popular cause.

headline.main: F.C.C. Backs Consumers in Unlocking of Cellphones
headline.print_headline: F.C.C. Backs Consumers In Unlocking Of Cellphones

snippet: Companies are increasingly responding to privacy concerns, not just because of regulatory requirements but because of customers’ desires.
abstract: Companies are increasingly responding to privacy concerns, not just because of regulatory requirements but because of customers’ desires.

headline.main: Daily Report: Web Privacy Becomes a Business Imperative

snippet: Wall Street turned positive despite Chinese plans to tighten curbs on the housing market there.
abstract: Investors brush off early anxiety about potential slowdown in China and push Dow Jones industrial average to its highest close of 2013.

headline.main: Despite News on China, Dow Closes on a High
headline.print_headline: Despite News on China, Dow Closes on a High

snippet: Big banks wrongfully foreclosed on more than 700 military members during the housing crisis. | Brokers in an elite group at JPMorgan Chase are said to face pressure to sell JPMorgan financial products. | Profit fell 17 percent at HSBC in 2012. | S...
abstract: Big banks wrongfully foreclosed on more than 700 military members during the housing crisis. | Brokers in an elite group at JPMorgan Chase are said to face pressure to sell JPMorgan financial products. | Profit fell 17 percent at HSBC in 2012. | Swiss citizens vote to impose severe curbs on executive compensation.

snippet: Increasingly, Internet companies like Microsoft, Facebook and Mozilla are pushing each other to prove to consumers that their data is safe and in their control.
abstract: Internet companies like Microsoft, Facebook and Mozilla are trying to gain market advantage by casting themselves as more privacy-friendly than their competitors, while also requiring increased privacy standards from companies they work with; trend follows increased customer awareness and threat of stricter regulations.

headline.main: Web Privacy Becomes a Business Imperative
headline.print_headline: Web Privacy Becomes A Business Imperative

snippet:
Samsung Electronics had no new phone to show at Mobile World Congress this week. But it was ubiquitous in Barcelona nonetheless.
